metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22707 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In lighttpd 1.4.46 through 1.4.63, the mod_extforward_Forwarded function of the mod_extforward plugin has a stack-based buffer overflow (4 bytes representing -1), as demonstrated by remote denial of service (daemon crash) in a non-default configuration. The non-default configuration requires handling of the Forwarded header in a somewhat unusual manner. Also, a 32-bit system is much more likely to be affected than a 64-bit system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22707` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-mod-authn-gssapi - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-mod-authn-pam - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-mod-authn-sasl - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-mod-deflate - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-mod-gnutls - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-mod-maxminddb - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-mod-mbedtls - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-mod-nss - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-mod-openssl - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-mod-vhostdb-pgsql - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-mod-webdav - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-mod-wolfssl - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-modules-dbi - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-modules-ldap - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-modules-lua - 1.4.64-1
lighttpd-modules-mysql - 1.4.64-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> According to upstream the impact is limited to 32-bit lighttpd and to specific lighttpd mod_extforward configurations expected to be rare.

criterions.comment: lighttpd package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.64-1').
